pr_title: get memory tests running on Payara, 5.0 RC #7089

timeline.message: get memory tests running on Payara, 5.0 RC #7089

timeline.bodyText: My only question would be if there's a way to handle this without the copy, i.e. we have a version upstream with sample data turned on, or we allow a parameter for sample data so that it can be turned on without having to change the yaml file.
timeline.author: scolapasta
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,10 @@ All the other pieces will be downloaded automatically (from the
 either locally, where you're running the script, or on the newly
 created instance.
 
+The script downloads an Ansible config file called `main.yml` which you
+should copy to `main2.yml` and edit to enable "sampledata". This config

replies.bodyText: @donsizemore and I have been discussing this. I believe the strategy would be to improve the spin up scripts to pass multiple -g arguments to ansible and one of those could be "sampledata = enabled" (paraphrasing).
replies.author: pdurbin
